CodeList.Name: Ophthalmic Exam Test Code

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the test codes that describe findings from ophthalmic examinations.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A measurement of the location, in degrees, of the flatter principal meridian on a 180-degree scale, where 90 degrees designates the vertical meridian and 180 degrees designates the horizontal meridian.
The fluid pressure within the eye.
A number or range of numeric values on the log scale that measures performance, function, quality, or ability.
The integer that describes the number of letters correctly identified by the subject during an eye chart assessment.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Number of Correct Eye Chart Letters

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A measurement of the extent of defect in vision caused by a mismatch of optical power between the cylindrical and horizontal meridians, resulting in sub-optimal reflection of light onto the retina. (NCI)

A measurement of the extent of defect in vision caused by a mismatch of optimal power between the cornea and/or lens and the length of the eyeball, resulting in sub-optimal reflection of light onto the retina. (NCI)

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Ophthalmic Exam Test Code Terminology
